title: People Still Complaining about Lethality....
body: I'm just playing Rammus jungle with Ninja Tabi saying, "Yeah, I'm sure Lethality is impossible to counter. Let's roll with that."

replies.body: so a tank isnt complaining about lethality because they can stack armor..... but what about others like adc/mage/ anything that doesnt build tanky :x

There's a thing called a Ninja Tabi (which is why I pointed out the Ninja Tabi on the post). Melts all your problems away. Don't like it? Here, take some health! ({{item:3078}}{{item:3071}}{{item:3027}}{{item:3152}}{{item:3030}}) Still don't like these viable options? There's more! ({{item:3715}}{{item:3046}}{{summoner:3}}{{summoner:21}}) 

Trying to be the Sham'Wow! guy, but I am failing. And for that, I am sorry. Just trying to be a little sarcastic to players who haven't tried playing something else to deal with a problem and end up whining about how their champion doesn't work in a different atmosphere.

Majority of these items are either situation or don't apply to every champ or role.
No ADC besides MF is building Black Cleaver, and even so it doesn't give you Armor anyways. 
Hardly any mages bother with the Hextech items and Tri-force really doesn't give you much health. 
PD isn't that good either, and only Mid-laners are allowed to pick their summoner spells.

I get the point of your post, but none of the options you offered are actual helpful into lethality besides {{item:3047}}

Are you kidding? Lethality is flat armor pen that scales with level. If a rengar smacks you for 1200 damage, and you have 1400 health but if an adc were to get say {{item:3078}}, {{item:3071}}, or {{item:3053}} then they can get a boost of health to have more health to survive with and then you can use lifesteal to heal back up. 

For mages you have {{item:3157}}, {{item:3027}}, {{item:3152}}, {{item:3030}}, {{item:3151}}, {{item:3116}}. These items give you stacks of health to survive on which you can use to counteract aggressive plays. with a balance of ap and health

My point is, if you are a carry and you are getting one shot by lethality abusers. you build defensively, you play to counter the build. grab a {{item:3026}} and you get a free revive. And you keep going on about Mages and ADCs but not many that play supports or bruiser/tanks are having many problems with lethality. Do you know why? They build health items which help their stats and still give them survivability! Don't like the meta? then change it! I just started playing Rammus jungle and I have been rushing Ninja before Cinderhulk. Now I'm almost mastery level 7 and I am almost to my promos for Bronze IV! (I know it doesn't sound impressive but I started league last year) 

Don't like what I am suggesting people to do to fix the situation? then just leave this discussion board. I was just trying to have some fun criticizing players who don't try to look for a way to solve a situation whilst proposing alternatives to players who want to try to fix problems in game.

{{item:3152}}, {{item:3030}}, and to a slightly lesser extent {{item:3116}}, {{item:3157}}  and {{item:3027}} are all quite situational items that few mages can take advantage of.

Many mages want to _avoid_ being in range to use the first two.  Rylai's has weak stats for a lot of mages, and some can't make good use of the slow.  It doesn't even give all that much health.  Rod of Ages require 10 minutes to stack up, crippling the early mid-game for many mages for whom that is their peak phase.

I'm actually not too bothered by lethality myself, but I am tired of people acting like mages have great defensive itemization.  Zhonya's is the only one that mages can commonly get, but even putting that in their builds can reduce their damage by quite a bit.

You don't use the hextech aggressively, they are meant to reposition. And any mage can run any of them. People are too reluctant to give up a little AP for more survivability. Or better yet don't think to play a bulkier mage who can survive potential one shots.

I mean I function fine with generally glass cannon builds, but I generally play long ranged mages.  I'm generally fine with lethality champions even when I'm playing regular mages.

Mages do need a ton of AP though.  The biggest advantage AP has over AD is that you can generally get a lot more AP than AD.  If you build two of those items you listed, you're likely to lose out on 100+ AP (unless it's ROA, but that's highly delayed power).

Oh and if a mage drops too far down in AP, the assassin will just finish the rest of the tankiness off with a couple 100% ad scaling auto attacks while the mage is incapable of killing the assassin.

Again, I'm generally fine, but I can understand the frustration.

I wasn't saying that you should build all of the listed item, I am just criticizing players who have a problem with the meta and refuse to think of alternatives for themselve. 

Building just one item that give you health should be just enough to prevent getting one shot so frequently. 

While you and I share different approaches to this meta, we at least are having a meaningful conversation in my opinion
Yeah I find these conversations interesting.  I like it when the person I talk to doesn't start calling me names. :)

Yes, let me just take Rammus in every role, mid, top, adc, supp, doesn't matter. Also, let me build ninja tabi and thornmail on every champ. Need magic pen? Nope, get ninja tabi. Need attack speed? Nope, get thornmail. Sure Rammus and Malphite and a couple others do well against lethality but just one or two health items doesn't help much against a Kha or a Jayce.

My point in the post was not necessarily about a particular champion, but rather about the fact that there are ways of dealing with Lethality. If you are losing lane as a carry, and to play and build defensively instead of building like you are winning. I have been playing Rammus jungle with relative success. I'm just tired of seeing people whining about meta and refuse to think about alternatives. The Rammus was just the roll into the punchline.
Thanks for noticing! I've been doing pretty well as Rammus lately and thought I'd do a Rammus post. The response was ok
I concur. I certainly do not main the champion in question, but I agree thoroughly. Cheers.
